summary: This is an affidavit filed by an Assistant U.S. Attorney in the Ghislaine Maxwell criminal case, certifying that the government has conferred in good faith with Maxwell's defense counsel regarding a request to delay disclosure of certain materials related to victims abused by Jeffrey Epstein outside the period charged in the indictment. The defense has refused to consent to the delay and intends to oppose any such motion.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case (20 Cr. 330 (MN)), whose defense counsel is refusing to consent to the government's request for delayed disclosure of certain victim-related materials.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: The Acting U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York, whose office the affiant works for as an Assistant U.S. Attorney.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referenced as the individual who abused victims outside the period charged in the indictment against Ghislaine Maxwell; the materials in question are related to these victims.

connections.description: The document references victims who were abused by Jeffrey Epstein, with Maxwell being charged in relation to Epstein's activities, implying their association in the alleged criminal conduct.
The AUSA represents the government in the proceedings against defendant Ghislaine Maxwell and is certifying interactions with her defense counsel.
The affiant is an Assistant U.S. Attorney in the Office of Audrey Strauss, the Acting U.S. Attorney.

events.title: Filing of Affidavit Regarding Disclosure Dispute
events.description: An Assistant U.S. Attorney files an affidavit certifying that the government and Ghislaine Maxwell's defense counsel could not agree on delaying disclosure of materials related to victims abused by Jeffrey Epstein outside the charged period.

keyFacts: The government sought to delay disclosure of materials related to victims abused by Jeffrey Epstein outside the time period charged in Ghislaine Maxwell's indictment.
Ghislaine Maxwell's defense counsel refused to consent to the delayed disclosure and intends to file an opposition to any government motion requesting such delay.
The affidavit certifies that the government conferred in good faith with the defense regarding this discovery issue, as required by court rules.
The document highlights ongoing pretrial disputes over the scope and timing of discovery in the Maxwell case, particularly concerning victim-related evidence.
